Dialogues.DialogueText: Wow, is the place people here call Glasgow?
Yes, the geography matches the map. This should be it.
According to the mission, we need to gather info on the missing cathedral materials.
Got it! Nexus, activate translation and disguise units, set mode: auto.
Translation And Disguise Units Engaged.
Deployment Mode: Auto.
Good morning, sir. We’re looking for missing materials for the cathedral. Seen anything odd?
Materials, ye say?
Can’t ya see I’m busy? Got iron to shape, no time for daft tales.
Sorry to bother you. We’re just passing merchants.
Heard some carts vanished near the kirk. Thought locals might know something.
Ah, those. Don’t concern myself with that, but folk say the stuff disappears at night.
Talk to the priests if you want more. And buy a hammer while you’re at it.
Might help you two build a wee cottage, eh?
Haha… thanks. We’ll think about it.
Thank you for the info, have a nice day.
Well, that got a bit awkward, didn’t it?
What did?
Ugh, never mind. Let’s go find the priest.
Alright.
Good afternoon, Father. We’re merchants who heard about the missing cathedral materials.
Ah, yes. I’ve been awaiting you.
Wait, you knew we were coming?
Yes, of course. It’s as the Lord foretold.
I see… As we were saying, we heard you might know more about the missing materials.
Why, of course. Most disappearances happen near the burn.
I’ve posted watchmen, but they see nothing. It’s as if phantoms take them.
Alas, it must be the Lord’s will.
Sounds like the Molendinar Burn is our next stop.
Yeah, let’s go.
One more thing: “The brightest light casts the darkest shadows; let not old truths blind your sight.”
Now, may the Lord bless your journey.
Thank you, Father!
Hey, what did he mean by those last words?
Probably just superstition.
Remember: “None possess wisdom greater than His Majesty the Emperor.”
“To trust any truth beyond his knowledge is heresy.”
I know, I know.
His Majesty is like a ray of hope to the Empire.
He overthrew the old tyrant 300 years ago and made the Empire prosper again.
And… He even gave us a chance…
Sorry, I got carried away…
Take your time. We’ll move after a break.
Hey!
AAAAAH!!! The monsters!
Nexus, check the disguise!
Disguise Protocol Active
BOTH OF YOU CALM DOWN!
Oh… just a young couple. Whew.
What are ye doing out so late?
That’s what we wanted to ask you.
We heard the material disappearances happened near the burn.
Most folks are asleep, so you seemed… suspicious.
Suspicious?! I’m just guarding what’s mine.
Every night, there’s a foul screech by the old cross.
My livestock go mad- barn in ruin, some even drop dead where they stand.
Foul screech?
Aye. Last night, I sear by Saint Mungo, I saw demons.
Red skin, blade-like ears and glowing orbs over their heads.
Told the watch, but they think I’m mad.
So here I am, with my hoe, ready to fight.
I’m sure you’d do well with that hoe, but leave it to us.
We’re here on the Father’s behalf.
Really?! Thank the Lord they actually sent someone!
I can finally sleep easy now.
Rest assured, and may the Lord’s blessings be with you!
Nice thinking, using the Father as an excuse.
What, you think I’m clueless?
Sometimes…
You were saying?
Never mind.
The farmer’s description matches our targets.
Agreed. Let’s set up an ambush.
Perfect. Two birds with one stone!
There they are!
Nexus, activate interference net!
Interference Field Cast
Nice, they’re trapped. Let’s move!
The Imperials!
Activate escape sequence!
It’s blocked- they’ve jammed it!
Curses, activate emergency protocol then!
Emergency Protocol Activating in 3…
Don’t let them get away!
Ahh-
Nexus, attach tracker!
Tracker Implanted
Completing Temporal Leap
Sorry, I panicked.
It’s fine. We’ve got their next location.
They won’t notice the tracker yet. Let’s finish the primary objective.
Yeah… let’s go.
This should be all the materials.
Yup, nice work.
Wait, Scepter, look up!
Is that a core fragment?!
Yes, looks like it! Must have sacrificed it to make the jump.
We might get some clues from it!
Good, Nexus, activate the illusion formation
Activating Illusion Formation
No one should bother us now.
We got it!
Good work, Player 2!
Nexus, send this to the ship for analysis.
Transporting Core Fragment
Can’t wait to see what juicy information this gives us~
You seem very excited.
Of course! First mission and we’re already killing it~
Still, I wouldn’t mind a break.
Save that for after the mission.
Sure, sure~
Let’s return the materials first.
I’ve been expecting you two.
Again?!
Indeed. The Lord has notified me of your visit.
I trust you two have the materials.
Yes, all accounted for.
Blessed be. As thanks, may I offer the Lord’s blessing?
Ye-
No thank you, we’ll be taking our leave.
Very well. I shall await your return… when the cathedral opens again, five decades from now.
The blessing…
You know very well that we should only receive blessings from His Majesty.
But no one would-
Argh, fine.
Let’s check the tracker.
Temporal coordinates are… 1189, 53 years from now.
Wait… didn’t the priest say we’d meet again in five decades?
It’s kinda creepy how he seems to predict everything.
Seems too accurate to just be coincidence…
Nevermind, let’s move before we lose the trail.
The revolutionaries should be nearby, right?
Yes, they’re likely hiding close.
Once we’re done, wanna check out the cathedral together?
We need to finish and report back. The council’s watching.
But can’t we do a quick stroll? Pretty pleease…
Sigh, Fine. Fifteen minutes.
Yipee!
Can never win against you…
Approaching Destination In Three Minutes
By the way,  according to Nous Entropía, today’s St Mungo’s Feast Day.
It’ll be too packed… maybe we should visit the River Clyde instead-
Wait. If it’s that crowded, the revolutionaries might-
Arriving: MSE-3 | Glasgow | 9:00H | XX.XX.1189 CE
Curses, those bastards got us!
No… we have to help the people!
Nexus, initiate descent protocol and establish connection to the Commander.
Initializing Descent Protocol
Descending…
Landing Complete
Connection status?
Commander Line Busy
Reattempting Connection In Five Minutes
Of all times…
Let’s move first! We’ll worry about the rest later
Mam, look out!
No! Let me go- my husband and daughter are inside!
Player 2, grab her!
Yes!
Connection Established
Agh, now?!
Hold the woman down, I’ll speak to the commander.
Got it.
Commander Angus, trainee Scepter reporting!
The situation is critical- Glasgow Cathedral is on fire!
As per Nous Entropía’s prediction!
What!? There was no mention of that anywhere!
Of course a mere imperial trainee wouldn’t know.
Proceed to secondary objective and do not intervene with the fire until it’s finished its job.
What do you mean by finished its job?! What about all the people inside?!
You don’t have the authority to question me!
This is a test for your platoon, and especially for that wench.
You want to keep her safe, right?
Seeing as you’ve done so much dirty work behind her back just to keep her fed.
Can’t we at least save that one woman?
No. She needs to prove her worth.
Disobey and your identity-
…Yes, sir.
That’s my obedient little prince.
You’ll regret this…
Hmm?
Nothing, sir. I’ll follow orders.
Relax, why so stiff, haha!
Connection Terminated
Please, miss, calm down!
How can I calm down- my whole family is inside!
I don’t even know if they’re alive or not!
But you should save yourself first!
And what happens if I save myself first?
I will have nothing left…
If you go in now, you’ll die too!
What’s the point of living now, when I have nothing left?!
No, listen to me! You can always rebuild-
Rebuild what? Graves?
You would never understand!
I do!
I lost my orphanage to a fire when I was a kid.
Almost everything was burnt but me and my friend managed stand back up.
So all I’m trying to say is that there is still hope even if-
No, we’re not the same!
You had someone to rely on, but what about me?
The man I love, and my sunshine Anna- all gone.
N-No, that’s not-
No, I’ve heard enough.
Thank you for worrying but I’m going in no matter what.
I won’t let you!
Player 2… Let go of her.
What are you talking about, Scepter!?
We can’t just let her run to her death!
The Commander ordered us not to interfere until the fire is extinguished.
Come on, Scepter, stop joking and come help me.
This is not a joke, let her go!
No, I can’t!
Nexus, calm her down.
Administering tranquilizing sequence.
N-
[Player 2 lets go of the woman’s hand as she collapses on the ground]
Thank you… now I can finally see them again…
Nexus, spare a core fragment to accompany the woman.
Core Fragmentation
You awake, Player 2?
What happened to the woman?
[Shakes head]
What did you do! I could have saved her…
You killed her!
No… My hands… they let go. I was the one…
Player 2!
Come to your senses!
My first… murder…
Player 2!
…I-I’m fine.
My head is just a little messy at the moment.
Take a rest, I’ll look for survivors.
No, let me come with you.
I need to do something… at least for those still alive.
Just don’t push yourself too far.
I see a child!
And… a core fragment… from Nexus.
Must be the woman’s child.
Let’s grab the fragment and get the child to safety.
This spot should be safe.
Nexus, extract the recording data from the fragment.
Extracting Data
No… Anna… her mother…
Player 2, Snap out of it!
I’m sure that she wanted her daughter to live.
So don’t torture yourself like that…
W-where am I?
You’re in a safe place now.
W-where are Mama and Papa?
[Hugs Anna]
I’m sorry… I’m so sorry…
Waa…
I don’t think you should continue.
No… It’s just… everything feels so wrong.
The empire… they’re not just letting this happen… right?
We were supposed to be saving everyone…
So why can we only act after everyone is dead?
Player 2-
No… don’t say anything.
I just… I need to believe there’s a reason for all this.
Because if there isn’t… then what have we been fighting for?
Sorry… Let’s check for more survivors, alright?
Player 2, I-
Alright?
Alright…
Hey, are you alright?
Praise be… I’m still breathing.
The Lord must have willed that I survive these flames.
My leg is badly injured, though, so I'll need your assistance to get out of here.
Alright, let's get going, I’ll bring you out.
Before this, let me offer a prayer for those who could not escape.
They were His flock, and now they return to His care.
May their suffering end, and may their souls find peace.
Nexus, sedate him- he doesn’t need to see this.
Administering tranquilizer.
Oh… we’re outside?
Yes, you’re safe now.
We’ll go back and search for more survivors.
Please, if you can, find the Father.
If he still draws breath, bring him back to us.
He should be near the High Altar, in the choir.
I see the priest.
Wait, these coordinates- they match the tracker.
That can’t be… is he one of them?
We can’t be sure so let’s proceed with caution.
My dear lost lambs, we meet once again as promised.
Tell me, are you part of the revolutionaries?
Yes. I am their leader, and also the same man you met five decades ago.
Why reveal so easily?
To gain your trust, of course.
Trust? After burning hundreds alive?!
This fire- it was no work of ours.
In fact, it was caused by you.
Lies! We did no such thing!
Then you better check with this “Nexus” of yours.
Nexus, confirm!
Information Access Denied
By who?!
Access Denied By Commander Angus
Argh, him again!
Nexus, I command you with my royal authority!
You Will Be Exposing Yourself, Your Highness Leon
I don’t care anymore, I’ve had enough of his games!
Wait, “Your Highness”?!
Not now, Player 2! I’ll explain later!
Command: Plant Ignition Matter On Construction Materials
Set Ignition: X:XXH | XX.XX.1189 CE
…No. This can’t be…
…Why didn’t you stop them if you knew?
It is all in Genesis’s calculations.
We seek to end the empire’s birth, not rewrite every tragedy.
We are no saints but just the lesser evil.
Then for this “calculation”, were we needed?
Smart. You were indeed needed, and the tracker was a perfect tool to lead you here.
You… you knew about the tracker?
Of course. I led you here so you could see the truth for yourselves.
Truth? All I see are corpses and ashes.
And yet, you still cling to their lies.
Here. Take this key. I’ll give it to you as a parting gift.
Use it on the core fragment you’ve been struggling with, and also on the other ones you’re yet to find.
May the Primordial Light guide your way… until we meet again.
Wait-
The ceiling groans. Stone crashes down. The priest vanishes into the rubble
